articles.author: Andy Fell
articles.title: Circadian clock controls sunflower blooms, optimizing for pollinators - Phys.org
articles.description: An internal circadian clock controls the distinctive concentric rings of flowering in sunflowers, maximizing visits from pollinators, shows a new study from plant biologists at the University of California, Davis. The work is published Jan. 13 in eLife.
